clinical_study.brief_title: Extension Study of IMO-8400 in Patients With Waldenström's Macroglobulinemia Who Completed Study 8400-401
clinical_study.official_title: An Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety, Tolerability, and Clinical Activity of IMO-8400 in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Waldenström's Macroglobulinemia Who Completed Study 8400-401

brief_summary.textblock: An extension study for patients who complete 24 weeks of IMO-8400 on study 8400-401.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who had no evidence of disease progression or toxicity while participating in study 8400-401 will continue to receive IMO-8400 until disease progression, adverse event or the investigator deems the goals of extended treatment with IMO-8400 have been met.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment until progression, intolerable adverse event or investigator deems goals of treatment met (an expected average of 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Long term safety and tolerability of IMO-8400 in patients with Waldenstrom's Macroglobulinemia who have completed 24 weeks of treatment in Protocol 8400-401 without evidence of disease progression or toxicity

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure total and monoclonal IgM levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment until progression, intolerable adverse event or investigator deems goals of treatment met (an expected average of 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the long-term treatment effect (clinical activity) of IMO-8400 using disease-specific international guidelines for classifying clinical response (including total and monoclonal IgM and clinical symptoms)

arm_group.arm_group_label: IMO-8400 at one of three dose levels

intervention.description: IMO-8400 at 0.6, 1.2 or 2.4 mg/kg/wk as defined per Protocol 8400-401
intervention.arm_group_label: IMO-8400 at one of three dose levels

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completed 24 weeks of treatment in Protocol 8400-401
Exclusion Criteria:
- Grade 3 (or higher) adverse event assessed as treatment-related at any time during the course of treatment under Protocol 8400-401.
- Has evidence of disease progression under Protocol 8400-401.
- Has received other anti-cancer therapies other than IMO-8400 since enrolling in Protocol 8400-401.
